info.title: Soda Cloud Reporting API
info.description:
This API enables you to query data from your Soda Cloud account. Use the data to build reporting dashboards that
communicate how users in your organization are adopting and making use of Soda Cloud.

Authentication
-----
The API supports both `HTTPBasic` authentication and `TokenAuth` authentication. Except for the `/get_token` endpoint,
which only supports HTTP Basic authentication.

- `HTTPBasic` authentication requires you to provide a username and password via headers. Each endpoint "Try It" section
will show you exactly how to do that.

- `TokenAuth` requires that you obtain a Soda token from the `/get_token` endpoint using your username and password
in accordance with the HTTPBasic Authentication framework. This token has an expiration of 30 minutes. The `/get_token`
endpoint makes this clear to you (see endpoint documentation below). You can then use this token to authenticate with
any of the other endpoints.

- `ApiKeyId` and `ApiKeySecret` allow you to use API keys generated in your Cloud Profile. Use this method if
your organization is using Single Sign-On (SSO). Provide your API Key Id and API Key Secret in the
`API_KEY_ID` and `API_KEY_SECRET` headers, respectively. If you do not know how to generate your API Key and Secret
pair follow the
[Connect Soda Core to Soda Cloud](https://docs.soda.io/soda-core/configure.html#connect-soda-core-to-soda-cloud)
documentation.


Testing
-----
You can test the API using the following methods.
* Test the API endpoints within the documentation. Provide the authentication credentials, when required,
in the **Auth** toggle in the testing window embedded in each endpoint's documentation.
* Test the API using an API testing platform such as Postman. Provide the `Basic Auth` authentication
credentials in your chosen testing platform.
* Test the API using an HTTP request library such as `httpx` in Python, an example of which follows.
```python
import httpx
request_result = httpx.post("<endpoint_URL>", auth=("username", "password"))
```

get.description:
Ping this endpoint to test whether the Reporting API is live.
Returns the sound of a Soda can opening along with a 200.

This enpoint allows you to obtain a limited duration API token to use in any of the other endpoints.

Make a query to this endpoint according to the `HTTPBasic` authentication headers
(see "Live testing" section on the right).

The expiration limit of the token is given to you in the response.

Returns
-------
An object of type `GetTokenResult`.

Find details about the response objects in the **Schemas** section or by unfurling the response
details.

This endpoint returns a list of audit trail events for the authenticated user's organization.

To obtain data from this endpoint, the authenticated user must be an **organization admin**
and the data returned is equivalent to the what an Organization admin would be able to get from
the Soda Cloud UI under "Organization Settings > Audit Trail".

Usage
-----
Use this endpoint to capture audit trail events for security and usage monitoring purposes.

Returns
-------
An object of type `AuditTrailResult` containing an array of `AuditTrailData`.

Find details about the response objects in the **Schemas** section or by unfurling the response
details.

202.description: Successful request but no data was returned

post.description:
This endpoint returns sign-up events for the authenticated user's organization.

To avoid incomplete reporting, Soda currently updates this data once per day and does not include
the current date (UTC).

**NOTE:** The event tracking solution does not currently track users who signed up via SSO.

Usage
-----
Use this endpoint to build reports about Soda's adoption across your organization.

Returns
-------
An object of type `SignUpsResult` containing an array of `SignUpData`.

Find details about the response objects in the **Schemas** section or by unfurling the response
details.

202.description: Successful request but no data was returned

post.description:
This endpoint provides the number of logins for a specific user per day.

To avoid incomplete reporting, Soda currently updates this data once per day and does not include
the current date (UTC).

**NOTE:** The event tracking solution does not currently track users who signed up via SSO.

Usage
-----
Use this endpoint to build reports about Soda's adoption throughout your organization.

Returns
-------
An object of type `SignInsResult` containing an array of `SignInData`

Find details about the response objects in the **Schemas** section or by unfurling the response
details.

202.description: Successful request but no data was returned

post.description:
This endpoint provides a daily count of activity events for the authenticated user's organization.

The endpoint groups events into one of two groups: "Level 0" or "Level 1".

**Level 0**: Activity of type **"Read"/"View"** (For example, view a dataset, view a monitor result.)
**Level 1**: Activity of type **"Create"/"Update"** (For example, create a monitor, update a monitor configuration.)

To avoid incomplete reporting, Soda currently updates this data once per day and does not include
the current date (UTC).

Usage
-----
Use this endpoint to build reports about Soda's adoption and usage throughout your organization.

Returns
-------
An object of type `DailyAccountActivityResult` containing an array of `DailyAccountActivityData`.

Find details about the response objects in the **Schemas** section or by
unfurling the response details.

202.description: Successful request but no data was returned

post.description:
This endpoint provides a real-time list of all the check that exist in your organization's account,
as well as the datasets upon which each check depends.

Usage
-----
Use this endpoint to enrich results from the `/datasets` or `/check_results` endpoints.

Returns
-------
An object of type `CheckResult` containing an array of `CheckData` for each check.

Find details about the response objects in the **Schemas** section or by
unfurling the response details.

202.description: Successful request but no data was returned

post.description:
This endpoint provides information about all the datasets that your team has connected to your organization's
Soda Cloud account.

Usage
-----
Use this endpoint to review the number of datasets Soda Cloud accesses, including each dataset's most recent scan
time and test failure counts.

Use the data from this endpoint to enrich other endpoints' data such as `/dataset_health` and
`/dataset_coverage`

Returns
-------
An object of type `DatasetsResult` containing an array of `DatasetsData`

Find details about the response objects in the **Schemas** section or by
unfurling the response details.

202.description: Successful request but no data was returned

post.description:
This endpoint provides a list of checks along with each checks's historical evaluation results.

Usage
-----
Use this endpoint to build reports that show the outcome of your checks over time. If you gathered high-level data
from the `/dataset_health` and `/dataset_coverage` endpoints, you can use this endpoint to examine more granular
data about checks that apply to each dataset.

You can provide multiple `dataset_ids` per request, and use the `from_datetime` parameter to optimize performance.
Use the `datasets` endpoint to first get a list of available datasets along with their IDs, then issue separate
queries one dataset at a time.

Keep the number of potentially parallel queries that you make to this endpoint small as they can face rate
limitations or poor performance.

Returns
-------
An object of type `CheckResultsResult` containing an array of `CheckResultsData`

Find details about the response objects in the **Schemas** section or by
unfurling the response details.

202.description: Successful request but no data was returned

post.description:
This endpoint provides you with a daily measure of the health of each of your datasets. Soda calculated a dataset's
health based on the number of checks that pass during a scan.

Usage
-----
Use this endpoint to get review the health of your datasets, and to see a high-level view of the more granular
information that the `/check_results` endpoint provides.

Use this endpoint in conjunction with the `/datasets` endpoint as the latter adds information about each
dataset.

Multiple `dataset_ids` are allowed per request, and use the `from_datetime` parameter to optimize performance.

Use the datasets endpoint to first get a list of available datasets along with their IDs, then issue separate
queries one dataset at a time.

Keep the number of potentially parallel queries that you make to this endpoint small as they can face rate
limitations or poor performance.

Returns
-------
An object of type `DatasetHealthResult` containing an array of `DatasetHealthData`

Find details about the response objects in the **Schemas** section or by
unfurling the response details.

202.description: Successful request but no data was returned

post.description:
This endpoint provides a daily measure of the test coverage of your datasets.
It derives a `relative_coverage_score` which compares the number of tests that apply to a single dataset to
other datasets connected to your organization's Soda Cloud account. (Refer to the `DatasetCoverageData` schema
for more information.)

Usage
-----
Use this endpoint to review the relative test coverage of your datasets, and to see a high-level view of the more
granular information that the `/tests_and_results` endpoint provides.

This endpoint is best used in conjunction with the `/datasets` endpoint as the latter augments the level of
information about each dataset.

Returns
-------
An object of type `DatasetCoverageResult` containing an array of `DatasetCoverageData`

Find details about the response objects in the **Schemas** section or by
unfurling the response details.

202.description: Successful request but no data was returned

post.description:
This endpoint provides a list of incidents (as well as basic information --see field definitions in the
`IncidentsData` schema) per report date.

You can filter for specific incident statuses, datasets, and report dates. See `IncidentsRequest` schema
for an exhaustive list of filter and aggregation options.

**NOTE:** In some rare cases, incidents are not attached to any monitors, in that case we cannot check wich
dataset they are attached to. These incidents are therefore ignored from the output.

Usage
-----
Use to build reports about the number of incidents at any given time on your Soda Cloud account.

Returns
-------
An object of type `IncidentsResult` containing an array of `IncidentsData`.

Find details about the response objects in the **Schemas** section or by
unfurling the response details.

202.description: Successful request but no data was returned

AuditTrailData.title: AuditTrailData

correlation_id.title: Correlation Id
correlation_id.description: Identifier of a given audited request. Note this column cannot be used as a primary key as it can span over multiple rows.

eventTime.title: Eventtime
eventTime.description: ISO UTC datetime at which the event happened.

ipAddress.title: Ipaddress
ipAddress.description: IP address of the user who performed the logged action.

email.title: Email
email.description: Email address of the user who performed the logged action.

apiKey.title: Apikey
apiKey.description: Obfuscated API key of the user who performed the logged action.

hash.title: Hash
hash.description: A tamper-proof security and verification hash.

AuditTrailData.description: Contains audited events from the authorized user's organization.

dataset_ids.title: Dataset Ids
dataset_ids.description: Dataset IDs (UUIDs from the Soda Cloud platform) to use as filter.

check_ids.title: Check Ids
check_ids.description: Check IDs (UUIDs from the Soda Cloud platform) to use as filter.

dataset_ids.title: Dataset Ids
dataset_ids.description:
Dataset IDs (UUID from the Soda Cloud platform). The `datasets` endpoint provides those IDs and can be used
to loop over this endpoint.

DailyAccountActivityData.title: DailyAccountActivityData

on_date.title: On Date
on_date.description: Date on which an activity for the authenticated user's organization took place.

active_level_0_users.title: Active Level 0 Users
active_level_0_users.description: Number of unique users who performed a Level 0 type of activity.

active_level_1_users.title: Active Level 1 Users
active_level_1_users.description: Number of unique users who performed a Level 1 type of activity.

DailyAccountActivityData.description:
Daily count of activity events for the authenticated user's organization.

Soda groups events into two groups: "Level 0" or "Level 1".
Event are grouped into "Level 0" and "Level 1":

    - Level 0: Activity of type "Read"/"View" (For example, view a dataset, view monitor result.)
    - Level 1: Activity of type "Create/Update" (For example, create a monitor, update a monitor configuration)

median_number_of_checks.title: Median Number Of Checks
median_number_of_checks.description: Median number of checks across all datasets in your organization.

max_number_of_checks.title: Max Number Of Checks
max_number_of_checks.description: Maximum number of checks across all datasets in your organization.

min_number_of_checks.title: Min Number Of Checks
min_number_of_checks.description: Minimum number of checks across all datasets in your organization.

standard_deviation_number_of_checks.title: Standard Deviation Number Of Checks
standard_deviation_number_of_checks.description: Standard deviation of the number of checks across all datasets in your organization.

mean_number_of_checks.title: Mean Number Of Checks
mean_number_of_checks.description: Mean number of checks across all datasets in your organization.

dataset_ids.title: Dataset Ids
dataset_ids.description: Dataset IDs (UUIDs from the Soda Cloud platform) to use as filter.

DatasetHealthData.title: DatasetHealthData

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: Organization ID of the dataset (UUID) in Soda Cloud.

dataset_id.title: Dataset Id
dataset_id.description: Unique identifier for a dataset (UUID) in Soda Cloud.

scan_date.title: Scan Date
scan_date.description: Date at which any number of scans were run.

critical.title: Critical
critical.description: Number of checks and monitors that failed with a Critical level alert.

info.title: Info
info.description: Number of checks and monitors that passed.

warning.title: Warning
warning.description: Number of checks and monitors that failed with a Warning level alert.

number_of_checks.title: Number Of Checks
number_of_checks.description: Number of checks and monitors executed.

percentage_passing_checks.title: Percentage Passing Checks
percentage_passing_checks.description: Proportion of checks and monitors that passed.

percent_change_percentage_passing_checks.title: Percent Change Percentage Passing Checks
percent_change_percentage_passing_checks.description:
Percentage change of the last data health point compared to a rolling average over the last
        3

DatasetHealthData.description: Dataset health information containing counts of passing or failing checks (warning or critical) per scan date.

dataset_ids.title: Dataset Ids
dataset_ids.description: List of dataset IDs (UUIDs from the Soda Cloud platform) to use as filter.

from_datetime.title: From Datetime
from_datetime.description: ISO 8601 datetime to specify the point in time from which you would like to get health historical data.

DatasetInfoData.title: DatasetInfoData

dataset_id.title: Dataset Id
dataset_id.description:
Identifier (UUID) of the dataset in Soda Cloud. Join with the results of the `datasets` endpoint for more
information.

number_of_checks.title: Number Of Checks
number_of_checks.description: Number of checks covering a specific dataset.

relative_coverage_score.title: Relative Coverage Score
relative_coverage_score.description:
A score derived by comparing the number of checks that apply to a single dataset to the number of checks
that apply to other datasets in your organization's Soda Cloud account. Soda applies the labels "good", "medium", and
"poor" based on a 3-ntile split.

DatasetInfoData.description:
Information about a dataset including whether a dataset is active or deleted,
and check coverage metrics.

dataset_id.title: Dataset Id
dataset_id.description: Identifier (UUID) of the dataset in Soda Cloud.

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: Identifier (UUID) of the organization in Soda Cloud.

dataset_name.title: Dataset Name
dataset_name.description: Name of the dataset in Soda Cloud corresponding to the name of the dataset in the data source.

dataset_label.title: Dataset Label
dataset_label.description: Custom name given to a dataset in Soda Cloud. Will often be identical to dataset_name

creator_id.title: Creator Id
creator_id.description: Identifier (UUID) of the check creator in Soda Cloud.

creator_user_type.description: User type of the check creator.

creator_last_login_at.title: Creator Last Login At
creator_last_login_at.description: Timestamp corresponding to the last time the owner logged into Soda Cloud.

owner_id.title: Owner Id
owner_id.description: Identifier (UUID) of the check owner in Soda Cloud.

owner_first_name.title: Owner First Name
owner_first_name.description: First name of the check owner.

owner_last_name.title: Owner Last Name

GetTokenResult.title: GetTokenResult

user.title: User
user.description: User's username (email addess used at sign up).

token.title: Token
token.description: API Token to use for authentication. This token expires. Its expiration is also provided in the response.

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: Organization ID (UUID) of the logged in user.

GetTokenResult.description: Soda Cloud API token and organisation ID information to use in this API's endpoints.

IncidentData.title: IncidentData

incident_id_report_date_id.title: Incident Id Report Date Id
incident_id_report_date_id.description: Incident report date Id (UUID) that uniquely identifies an incident and a report_date as shown in the Soda Cloud Incidents page.

incident_id.title: Incident Id
incident_id.description: Incident ID (UUID) of the incident in the Soda Cloud Incidents page.

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: ID (UUID) of the corresponding organization for the incident shown in the Soda Cloud Incidents page.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: ISO timestamp of the date at which the incidents was created in the Soda Cloud Dataset page.

last_updated.title: Last Updated
last_updated.description: ISO timestamp of the date at which the incident was last updated.

check_id.title: Check Id
check_id.description: Check ID (UUID) of the check for which the incident was created.

check_result_id.title: Check Result Id
check_result_id.description: Check result Id (UUID) of check result to which incident corresponds.

dataset_id.title: Dataset Id
dataset_id.description: Dataset ID (UUID) of the dataset in the Soda Cloud Dataset page.

title.title: Title
title.description: Title of the incident as shown in the Soda Cloud Incidents page.

check_name.title: Check Name
check_name.description: Name of the check for which the incident was created as shown in the Soda Cloud Incidents page.

severity.title: Severity
severity.description: Severity of the incident as shown in the Soda Cloud Incidents page.

description_notes.title: Description Notes
description_notes.description: Description notes of the incident as shown in the incident overview.

resolution_notes.title: Resolution Notes
resolution_notes.description: Resolution notes of the incident as shown in the incident overview.

lead_id.title: Lead Id
lead_id.description: Lead ID (UUID) of the lead assigned to the incident in the Soda Cloud Incidents page.

lead_email.title: Lead Email
lead_email.description: Email of the lead assigned to the incident in the Soda Cloud Incidents page.

reporter_id.title: Reporter Id
reporter_id.description: Reporter ID (UUID) of the user that reported the incident in the Soda Cloud Incidents page.

reporter_email.title: Reporter Email
reporter_email.description: Reporter email of the user that reported the incident in the incident overview.

report_date.title: Report Date
report_date.description: Report date for which the incident information is shown.

resolved_at.title: Resolved At
resolved_at.description: ISO timestamp of the date at which incident was resolved in the Soda Cloud Incidents page.

status.title: Status
status.description: Status of the incident as shown in the Soda Cloud Incidents page.

IncidentData.description: Contains incident information (see field documentation for explanations)

dataset_ids.title: Dataset Ids
dataset_ids.description: Dataset IDs (UUIDs from the Soda Cloud platform) to use as filter.

status.title: Status
status.description:
String representing the status of issues you want to retrieve. Currently you can retrieve either:
- all 'resolved' issues or
- all 'unresolved' issues

from_datetime.title: From Datetime
from_datetime.description: ISO timestamp from which you want to retrieve incidents. Defaults to last 31 days.

to_datetime.title: To Datetime
to_datetime.description: ISO timestamp up to which you want to retrieve incidents. Defaults to today.

NoContentError.title: NoContentError

resource.title: Resource
resource.description: Name of the resource. Usually the same string as the endpoint.

data.title: Data
data.description: Generic data payload from the query. Should be overidden with a more specific pydandic model.

detail.title: Detail
detail.default: No results for the requested data. If you think this is a bug and you should be getting results, get in touch with us.

NoContentError.description: Response Schema of a NoContent Error

SignInData.title: SignInData

user_email.title: User Email
user_email.description: Email address of the user who signed in.

on_date.title: On Date
on_date.description: Date on which the user signed in.

count_sign_in.title: Count Sign In
count_sign_in.description: Number of times a specific user signed in.

SignInData.description: Count of sign-in events per user per day.

SignUpData.title: SignUpData

user_email.title: User Email
user_email.description: Email address of the user who signed up.

on_date.title: On Date
on_date.description: Date on which the user signed up.

SignUpData.description: List of sign-up events per user per date.
